str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.
